Detailed Description

In addition to the IOCTLs listed above the following common IOCTLs are applicable to this driver

  • FVID2_STOP
  • IOCTL_VPS_SET_COEFFS
  • IOCTL_VPS_GET_DEI_CTX_INFO
  • IOCTL_VPS_SET_DEI_CTX_BUF
  • IOCTL_VPS_GET_DEI_CTX_BUF
  • IOCTL_VPS_SET_DEI_FMD_CFG
  • IOCTL_VPS_RD_DEI_FMD_STAT
  • IOCTL_VPS_WR_DEI_FMD_UPDATE
  • IOCTL_VPS_SET_RANGE_MAP_REDUCT_CFG
  • IOCTL_VPS_GET_RANGE_MAP_REDUCT_CFG
  • IOCTL_VPS_READ_ADV_DEI_CFG
  • IOCTL_VPS_WRITE_ADV_DEI_CFG
  • IOCTL_VPS_READ_ADV_SC_CFG
  • IOCTL_VPS_WRITE_ADV_SC_CFG

Macro Definition Documentation

#define IOCTL_VPS_M2M_GET_VPE_PARAMS   (VPS_M2M_VPE_IOCTL_BASE + 0x0001U)

Get VPE parameters.

This IOCTL can be used to get the VPE hardware parameters. This IOCTL could be called at anytime after creating VPE M2M driver instance.

Parameters
cmdArgs[IN] Vps_M2mVpeParams *
cmdArgsStatus[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure.
#define IOCTL_VPS_M2M_SET_VPE_PARAMS   (VPS_M2M_VPE_IOCTL_BASE + 0x0000U)

Set VPE parameters.

This IOCTL can be used to set the VPE hardware specific parameters. This IOCTL should be called after creating VPE M2M driver instance and before queueing or starting the M2M driver. Starting the M2M driver without calling this IOCTL will result in error.

Once the operation is started this IOCTL can't be invoked and will result in error.

Once the M2M driver is stopped, application could call this IOCTL to reconfigure the VPE block with a different set of parameters.

Parameters
cmdArgs[IN] const Vps_M2mVpeParams *
cmdArgsStatus[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure.
#define IOCTL_VPS_VPE_OVERRIDE_PREV_FLD_BUF   (VPS_M2M_VPE_IOCTL_BASE + 0x0002U)

M2M VPE IOCTL to replace the internal state of the previous field buffers.

This IOCTL could be used by the application to control the previous fields used to deinterlace the next request. This will be useful if the application wants to operate with lower FPS and still wants to perform proper deinterlacing operation.

The driver will return the FVID2 frames held by the driver in the same input structure.

When using this IOCTL the application should ensure that there is no input request pending with the driver. Otherwise the driver will return error.

Parameters
cmdArgs[IN/OUT] Vps_M2mVpeOverridePrevFldBuf *
cmdStatusArgs[OUT] NULL
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure
